left ear cartilage graft.context: Left ear cartilage graft, repair of nasal vestibular stenosis using an ear cartilage graft, cosmetic rhinoplasty, left inferior turbinectomy.

repair of nasal vestibular stenosis usin.context: Left ear cartilage graft, repair of nasal vestibular stenosis using an ear cartilage graft, cosmetic rhinoplasty, left inferior turbinectomy.

cosmetic rhinoplasty.context: Left ear cartilage graft, repair of nasal vestibular stenosis using an ear cartilage graft, cosmetic rhinoplasty, left inferior turbinectomy.

left inferior turbinectomy.context: Left ear cartilage graft, repair of nasal vestibular stenosis using an ear cartilage graft, cosmetic rhinoplasty, left inferior turbinectomy.

posttraumatic nasal deformity.context: Postoperative Diagnoses: 1. Posttraumatic nasal deformity.   2. Nasal obstruction.   3. Nasal valve collapse.   4. Request for cosmetic change with excellent appearance of nose.

nasal obstruction.context: The patient is with symptomatic nasal obstruction and fixed nasal valve collapse following a previous nasal fracture and attempted repair.

nasal valve collapse.context: Postoperative Diagnoses: 1. Posttraumatic nasal deformity.   2. Nasal obstruction.   3. Nasal valve collapse.   4. Request for cosmetic change with excellent appearance of nose.

request for cosmetic change with excelle.context: Postoperative Diagnoses: 1. Posttraumatic nasal deformity.   2. Nasal obstruction.   3. Nasal valve collapse.   4. Request for cosmetic change with excellent appearance of nose.

nasal fracture.context: The patient is with symptomatic nasal obstruction and fixed nasal valve collapse following a previous nasal fracture and attempted repair.

attempted repair.context: The patient is with symptomatic nasal obstruction and fixed nasal valve collapse following a previous nasal fracture and attempted repair.

fixed nasal valve collapse.context: The patient is with symptomatic nasal obstruction and fixed nasal valve collapse following a previous nasal fracture and attempted repair.

symptomatic nasal obstruction.context: The patient is with symptomatic nasal obstruction and fixed nasal valve collapse following a previous nasal fracture and attempted repair.

nasal septal deviation.context: The septal angle was approached and submucoperichondrial flaps were elevated. Severe nasal septal deviation to the right hand side and evidence of an old fracture with a separate alignment of the cartilaginous nose from the bony nose was encountered.

old fracture.context: The septal angle was approached and submucoperichondrial flaps were elevated. Severe nasal septal deviation to the right hand side and evidence of an old fracture with a separate alignment of the cartilaginous nose from the bony nose was encountered.

separate alignment of the cartilaginous.context: The septal angle was approached and submucoperichondrial flaps were elevated. Severe nasal septal deviation to the right hand side and evidence of an old fracture with a separate alignment of the cartilaginous nose from the bony nose was encountered.

upper laterals were divided.context: The upper laterals were divided and medial and lateral osteotomies were carried out.

medial and lateral osteotomies were carr.context: The upper laterals were divided and medial and lateral osteotomies were carried out.

inadequate septal cartilage.context: Inadequate septal cartilage was noted to be present for use as spreader graft; therefore, left postauricular incision was made, and the conchal bowl cartilage graft was harvested, and it was closed with 3-0 running locking chromic with a sterile cotton ball pressure dressing applied.

left postauricular incision.context: Inadequate septal cartilage was noted to be present for use as spreader graft; therefore, left postauricular incision was made, and the conchal bowl cartilage graft was harvested, and it was closed with 3-0 running locking chromic with a sterile cotton ball pressure dressing applied.

conchal bowl cartilage graft was harvest.context: Inadequate septal cartilage was noted to be present for use as spreader graft; therefore, left postauricular incision was made, and the conchal bowl cartilage graft was harvested, and it was closed with 3-0 running locking chromic with a sterile cotton ball pressure dressing applied.

ear cartilage graft was placed.context: Ear cartilage graft was then placed to put two spreader grafts on the left and one the right.

spreader grafts were placed.context: Ear cartilage graft was then placed to put two spreader grafts on the left and one the right.

crushed ear cartilage was placed.context: Crushed ear cartilage was then placed in the pockets above the spreader grafts in the area of the deficient dorsal nasal height and the lateral nasal sidewall height.

mucoperichondrial flaps were closed.context: Mucoperichondrial flaps were closed with 4-0 plain gut suture.

skin was closed.context: The skin was closed with 5-0 chromic and 6-0 fast absorbing gut.

Doyle splints were placed.context: Doyle splints were placed on each side of nasal septum and secured with 3-0 nylon and a Denver splint was applied.

Denver splint was applied.context: Doyle splints were placed on each side of nasal septum and secured with 3-0 nylon and a Denver splint was applied.
